comments.html: I use systemd’s networkctl for my configs and I think it’s okay. I managed to put together some unit templates that puts FRR and a set of interfaces into their own network namespace. I like it this way because no other services run in the same namespace unless I configure them to explicitly do so (with a other template). I put it up on GH so others can benefit: https://github.com/brotherdust/systemd-netns-frr
comments.name: Jarad O

comments.html:
Dell OS10 "config plane" is based on Linux, but it's more like Arista... i.e., you can run bash & co, but it does not really use the standard Linux forwarding capabilities.

On the other hand, VyOS it's really using the Linux standard forwarding plane, it's "only" a config layer for multiple backends (i.e., networking, FRR, Strongswan, ...).
comments.name: Stefano Sasso
